intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. capituliferum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and hairy. The plant produces yellow composite flowers arranged in a single, compact head, which is characteristic of the genus Hieracium. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its flowering period occurs from June to August, making it a notable species in early summer flora.
